column4: When i check my updates from update manager of Ubuntu 10.04 (updated) some of package information are not downloading (i mean they are failing) but the update manager works fine. Why some of them are failing? How to understand which are the softwares who are not updating for me ?
use the terminal try sudo apt-cache show pkgnamehere
can you please give me a command ? i can use the command which you gave me...
sry i was gone.. did u fix it?
the ubuntu software center does always include detailed information for all packages
but using the command i gave you earlier would
i know the software center. but i am talking about updates now...
my system's all packages are not updating. that is a big problem. opera is not udpating. this is not possible..
ok. whats the output of : sudo apt-get install opera
it says is already installed latest version.
ok now tell me the output for: sudo apt-cache show opera | grep ^Ver
the repositories are not made for lucid
but how i update the Opera 2 weeks before ?
also i had installed nautilus-elementary theme from this way.
u chose deb.opera.com/ stable non-free. this is the latest version in there
if you move to the unstable non-free you can update more often w/ more problems
